SafetyInspectionBy: IA Dept. of Ag & Land Stewardship

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary



Manson Ag Services, Inc.

Manson, IA

Mark Calmer

1-712-469-3044



1. Facility Policy.



    The owners, management and employees of  Manson Ag Services, Inc. are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Calhoun County LEPC, and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the people and the environment.



2. Facility Information.

 

    The primary activity at the facility is the storage of fertilizers for sale to farmers. Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production. 



3. Worst-Case Scenario and Alternate Release Scenario



    An analysis of the potential off-site consequences of hypthetical worst-case and alternative-case accidental releases have been addressed in our Hazard Assessment and Information is in our Risk Management Program.



4. Accidental Relase Prevention Program



    The facility is in compliance with the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia". The OSHA standard is referenced in the RMP Registration Form, see Section 8.3 (b).



5. Five-Year Accident History

    

    There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility: no to our knowledge, has THERE BEEN ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES resulting in off site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage, or environmental damage.



6. Emergency Action Plan.



    The facility has:



    a. A written action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38;



    b. Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA).

   

  c. If a la

rge release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility, the required response action is to evacuate the area of      the spill and call 911 and all applicable emergency reponse numbers listed in our Emergency Action Plan.

7. Planned Chages to Improve Safety.



    Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions of the facility. There are no additional specific safety recommemdations regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.
